title: Help selecting a typeface for logo
content:
I am looking for a typeface that has the feel of turn of the century american wrought iron work. Here's some examples:

[http://www.andalucia.com/craft/image/352214handicraft.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.andalucia.com/craft/image/352214handicraft.jpg "http://www.andalucia.com/craft/image/352214handicraft.jpg")

[http://www.greenmountaintaps.com/images/display\_canalstreet.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.greenmountaintaps.com/images/display_canalstreet.jpg "http://www.greenmountaintaps.com/images/display\_canalstreet.jpg")

[http://www.fenet.co.uk/coats/pic21.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.fenet.co.uk/coats/pic21.jpg "http://www.fenet.co.uk/coats/pic21.jpg")

You get the idea.

Thanks in advance

Beau
author: BeauSim

comments.content:
Something like this? Or more ornate?

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow")

I think ... more ornate (possibly the wrong word)

Looking for something that looks like it belongs in the 1900's and has the feel of the wrought iron style. Not too ornate though, it has to be clearly readable.

Suggestions from all over the map:  
 [Kilkenny](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/kilkenny.html) from P22  
 [Missionary](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=106) from Emigre  
 [Calliope](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/letterheadfonts.com/contributors/briankniceley/strongcaliope.shtml) from Letterhead Fonts (more Art Nouveau than Western)

How about Eccentric?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/eccentric/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/eccentric/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/eccentric/")

or Berolina

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/berolina/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/berolina/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/berolina/")

ChrisL
Did you find what you were looking for?

for some reason, I haven't been able to get on all day today (was typophile down or was it just me?)

Anyway... WOW! I had no idea there were so many options out there. Here's the rundown (my opinion only)

- Escrow - Not quite curly enough (old looking)
- Precosia - Very nice, might be a bit hard to read at smaller  
 sizes, lightbox material
- American West - Close, but a bit too cliche western looking
- Maverick's Luck - Close, add that one to the lightbox
- Kilkenny - might be a bit too light
- Missionary - I couldn't have asked for a more exact font for what  
 I asked, but it's too thin, too
- Calliope - getting really close here, add this one to the  
 lightbox too
- Eccentric - I didn't even think of something like that, could  
 work
- Berolina - Again, a direction I didn't even think of, I love this  
 board!
- Cafe Corina - VERY CLOSE! In fact, I plugged away in that site a  
 bit, Billhead and Tyler are almost perfect. Added all three to the lightbox

Okay, I just got some further direction. The logo type will read "Neverthelesser" and it is to be a short animated film set in 1906 San Francisco on the day of the big quake. I think we have the typefaces here to work with, does anyone have any suggestions as to how to maybe mix & match them to make an interesting logotype for a short animated film?

I would love you thoughts and thank you so very much for these suggestions. Huh, education can be fun! I guess my teachers were right all along. Who'd a thought?

Hmm maybe search through the thread about historical resources. I posted a link to vintage SanFransisco Pictures and art. Could browse that and look for some inspiration.

That is a nice link of fonts from all the sugguestions! I was going to sugguest something from letterhead as well. But they don't have a typesetter so it's a bit annoying.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/copperplate-deco/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/copperplate-deco/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/copperplate-deco/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/eureka/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/eureka/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/eureka/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/illyrian/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/illyrian/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/illyrian/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/gretchen/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/gretchen/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/gretchen/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/penelope/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/penelope/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/penelope/")

In fact have a look through all Dan Solo's typefaces there are many with an Edwardian feel to them  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=solo&page=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20130504015704/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=solo&page=1 "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=solo&page=1")

Tim

More great sellections! Thank you to all for all your great help. Hopefully this thread serves as a great resource fo others too. I'll keep you guys posted on the progress of the logo & film.

Thanks!
